problem: A 60 g arrow is fired from a bow whose string exerts an average force of 100N on the arrow over a distance of 80cm. (a) What is the speed of the arrow as it leaves the bow? (b) What is the power given to the arrow?

variables.meaning: distance over which string force acts
pressure of average value delivered to arrow

steps.explanation: State the fundamental formulas needed for this problem
steps.notations: We will use F = ma, W = Fd, KE = ½mv², v² = v₀² + 2ad, v = v₀ + at, and P = W/t

steps.explanation: Define the variables with values given in the problem
steps.notations: Given: m = 60 g = 0.060 kg, F₍avg₎ = 100 N, d = 80 cm = 0.80 m, v₀ = 0

steps.explanation: Calculate acceleration using Newton's second law
Calculate final speed using the kinematic equation
Calculate work done on the arrow
Calculate the time interval using v = v₀ + at
Calculate the average power delivered to the arrow

solution:
Given: m = 60 g = 0.060 kg, F₍avg₎ = 100 N, d = 80 cm = 0.80 m, v₀ = 0

(a) Finding the speed:
Using F = ma:
a = F₍avg₎/m = 100/0.060 = 1667 m/s²

Using v² = v₀² + 2ad:
v² = 0 + 2(1667)(0.80) = 2667 m²/s²
v = √(2667) ≈ 51.6 m/s ≈ 5.2 × 10¹ m/s

(b) Finding the power:
W = Fd = (100)(0.80) = 80 J

Using v = v₀ + at:
t = v/a = 51.6/1667 ≈ 0.0310 s = 3.1 × 10⁻² s

P₍avg₎ = W/t = 80/0.031 ≈ 2581 W ≈ 2.6 kW
